Description: T cell fate decisions are important for sustained anti-tumor immunity. In this session we will discuss the development of regulatory, effector and memory CD4 and CD8 T cells and the stability of these fate choices at the epigenetic level. PD-1 blockade reinvigorates a subset of stem-like progenitor CD8 T cells. How this key subset of cells is maintained and the role of PD-1 signaling on T cell states from naïve to memory cells will be explored. TCR signaling is also centrally important in naïve T cell priming and in effector cell recognition of tumor antigens presented on MHC. Decreasing the T cell signaling threshold increases effector cell cytokine production and can recruit lower affinity, self-antigen specific T cells into the anti-tumor pool. T cell exhaustion and methods of preventing or overcoming exhaustion will be discussed.
